meanings.definition: The science of laws; especially, the science of the laws which govern the moral world.
meanings.sent1: Studying nomology helps us understand the rules that guide our behavior.
meanings.sent2: Legal scholars often refer to nomology in their research on ethics.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for nomology made the class surprisingly engaging.
meanings.sent4: In the nomology of human interactions, kindness is a fundamental law.
meanings.sent5: The book on nomology painted a vivid picture of moral principles.

meanings.sent1: The library had a section dedicated to nomology and legal texts.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a comprehensive nomology outlining the regulations of the society.
meanings.sent3: The nomology she presented was so detailed, it could rival any legal document.
meanings.sent4: His nomology on traffic laws was a masterpiece of clarity and organization.
meanings.sent5: The nomology he crafted was a valuable resource for understanding legal systems.
